home.title: GitMaster
home.subtitle: Visual
home.description: Master Git through interactive visualization. Watch branches grow, commits form, and merges happen in real-time. Learn by doing, not reading.

features.title: Learn Git Visually
features.subtitle: No more memorizing commands. See how Git actually works under the hood.

commits.title: Visual Commits
commits.description: See your commits come alive as nodes on an interactive graph

branches.title: Branch Mastery
branches.description: Create and navigate branches with beautiful visualizations

merges.title: Merge Magic
merges.description: Watch merges happen in real-time with animated pathways

terminal.title: Real Commands
terminal.description: Practice actual Git commands in a safe sandbox environment

cta.title: Ready to Master Git?
cta.description: Start your journey from commits to complex merges. Become a Git expert in no time.

home.footer: Built with ‚ù§Ô∏è for developers who want to truly understand Git

level-1.title: First Snapshot
level-1.subtitle: Genesis
level-1.description: Git saves snapshots of your project, not just changes. Each commit is a complete picture of all your files at that moment.
level-1.goal: Initialize a repository and make your first commit.
hints: Run "git init" to create a new repository
Modify a file to see it change status
Use "git add ." to stage all changes
Run "git commit -m message" to save

level-2.title: Time Traveler
level-2.subtitle: Genesis
level-2.description: Git lets you travel through time! Use checkout to visit any commit and see your project as it was.
level-2.goal: Create 2 commits, then checkout the first one (detached HEAD).
hints: Make a change and commit it
Run "git log" to see commit history
Use "git checkout <hash>" with the first commit's hash
Notice HEAD is now "detached"

level-3.title: Branching Timeline
level-3.subtitle: Multiverse
level-3.description: Branches are lightweight pointers to commits. They let you work on features without affecting the main code.
level-3.goal: Create a new branch called "feature" and make a commit on it.
hints: Use "git branch feature" to create a branch
Run "git checkout feature" to switch to it
Or use "git checkout -b feature" for both steps
Make a commit on the new branch

level-4.title: Merging Paths
level-4.subtitle: Multiverse
level-4.description: Merge brings changes from one branch into another. Fast-forward is simple, but sometimes you need a merge commit.
level-4.goal: Merge your feature branch back into main.
hints: First, checkout main: "git checkout main"
Then merge: "git merge feature"
Watch the graph update!
Notice if it's a fast-forward or merge commit

level-5.title: Soft Landing
level-5.subtitle: Regret & Rewrite
level-5.description: Made a mistake? Reset lets you undo commits. Soft keeps changes, hard throws them away.
level-5.goal: Make a commit, then reset it with --soft to keep your changes.
hints: Make a change and commit it
Run "git reset --soft HEAD~1"
Your changes are still in the working directory!
Try "git status" to see
